rule_of_thirds::markdown_card_0::text: When you upload your portrait it will be shared with the StoryMaker community. [Check out portraits made by other StoryMakers here.](https://www.storymaker.org/)
rule_of_thirds::text_card_1::text: Now turn on the grid in your camera app, and experiment with the rule of thirds.
rule_of_thirds::text_card_0::text: The rule of thirds is the most basic skill a photographer needs. Let’s look at some examples.
rule_of_thirds::intro_card_0::headline: Posed Portraits
rule_of_thirds::title: Rule of Thirds
rule_of_thirds::preview_card_2::header: Great photos use the entire frame well, but place the most important objects where the grid intersects.
rule_of_thirds::preview_card_0::header: Strong visuals make use of all the space in the frame. Use these lines to frame the horizon or your subject’s eyes in a portrait.
rule_of_thirds::clip_card_0::goals[0]: Try to use at least 3 points of the grid in your photo.
rule_of_thirds::preview_card_1::header: To use your entire frame well, think across the frame, place important elements of the frame on these lines.
